author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Department of Fire and Emergency Services has slapped notices on 13 malls in the city to clear the approach roads, which have been encroached upon either as parking spaces or for storage, which could hamper operations during emergencies. M.N. Reddi, Director General of Fire and Emergency Services, said that the notices were issued on Tuesday based on a fire audit report.

15-day deadline

Mr. Reddi said that these malls have been given a fortnight to clear the encroachments and adhere to the fire safety norms, failing which the Department is empowered to direct BESCOM to disconnect the power supply, Mr. Reddi said.

“We have issued notices to many malls in the city to set right violations of the National Building Code as per the original clearance certificate.” “Malls have high footfalls. Therefore, fire safety measures are of extreme importance ,” he added.

As per the State government notification issued on July 2011, the owners or the association of high-rise buildings had to get their structures inspected by the agencies empanelled by the Department. They should submit an affidavit mentioning the working condition of the fire safety equipment along with the inspection report to the Department, BBMP or the municipal authorities concerned.
title: Notices to 13 malls for violations
